metadata.title: CVE-2021-37998 on Ubuntu 18.04 FIPS Certified (bionic) - medium
metadata.description:
Use after free in Garbage Collection in Google Chrome prior to 95.0.4638.69allowed a remote attacker to potentially exploit heap corruption via acrafted HTML page.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2021-37998` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

chromium-browser - 95.0.4638.69-0ubuntu0.18.04.1
chromium-browser-l10n - 95.0.4638.69-0ubuntu0.18.04.1
chromium-chromedriver - 95.0.4638.69-0ubuntu0.18.04.1
chromium-codecs-ffmpeg - 95.0.4638.69-0ubuntu0.18.04.1
chromium-codecs-ffmpeg-extra - 95.0.4638.69-0ubuntu0.18.04.1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: chromium-browser package in bionic was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '95.0.4638.69-0ubuntu0.18.04.1').
